etymology.interpretation: 永 signals the idea of something enduring and continuous, fitting the sense of long-flowing water or a river name. 羊 contributes the sound, tracing back to an Old Chinese reading close to *laŋs that developed to yàng.

examples.chinese: 江水羕流，不舍昼夜(江水羕流，不捨晝夜。)
examples.pinyin: Jiāngshuǐ yàng liú, bù shě zhòuyè.
examples.english: The river flows long and unceasing, day and night.

examples.chinese: 古籍中，“羕”指水流绵长，亦可用作河名(古籍中，「羕」指水流綿長，亦可用作河名。)
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí zhōng, “yàng” zhǐ shuǐliú miáncháng, yì kě yòng zuò hémíng.
examples.english: In ancient texts, “羕” refers to a long-flowing stream and can also serve as a river name.

examples.chinese: 当地以河道之长名曰“羕水”(當地以河道之長名曰「羕水」。)
examples.pinyin: Dāngdì yǐ hédào zhī cháng míng yuē “Yàngshuǐ”.
examples.english: The locality names the river for its length, calling it “Yang River.”
